Description: Bronze lamp: deep bowl-body and flat-topped nozzle, with an expanded, rounded tip, the outer edge of which has tongue decoration. 'Volute-spines' at the body end of the nozzle; protuberances on each side near the tip resemble the tops of such spines: all have sunken tops. The nozzle-top is decorated with a sunken palmette; the wick-hole is semicircular with a re-entrant curve. The top of the lamp is slightly dished with a moulded rim, the outer moulding beaded. Small central filling-hole. At the rear is a broad ring-handle, with a damaged double-lobed ornament above it; in front of the ornament are hinge-pieces (one missing) for a lamp-lid, now lost. Raised base-ring with internal 'lathe-turned' mouldings. Hinged lid lost. Surface colouration: dark green.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Maj Charles Kerr Macdonald
Curator's comments: Near: Conticello de' Spagnolis, M., and De Carolis, E., 1983. ‘Museo nazionale romano, I Bronzi iv, I, Le Lucerne’. Rome : De Luca, II, 9, 12, 13.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (3615)
Condition: incomplete - lid lost, handle-ornament damaged. Surface coloration: dark green.
